bills.title: Establishing 3-year mandatory prison sentence for person convicted of illegal possession of Schedule I and Schedule II drugs
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a mandatory three-year sentence for possession of Schedule I or II substances, except cannabis. The bill provides exceptions from prosecution for persons incidentally exposed to the substances or who are forced to possess the substances. And, the bill provides a conditional discharge for first offenders and release with non-extraditable warrant, with a bus ticket to any state West of the Mississippi River.

bills.title: Relating to legalizing cannabis production, sales and adult consumption
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to legalize the personal use and possession of cannabis by adults; providing for a county option election to allow for the production and sales in that county; providing for regulation by the Bureau of Health; authorizing an excise and local sales tax on cannabis; prohibiting underage use; and preserving current laws relating to allowing employers and property owners to prohibit use or possession.

bills.title: Increasing penalty for felony distribution of controlled substance classified in Schedule I or II
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalty for felony distribution of a controlled substance classified in Schedule I or II which is a narcotic drug or methamphetamine; and increase the penalty for drug delivery resulting in death.

bills.title: Relating to drugs and adding a provision relating to the scheduling of crystalline polymorph psilocybin approved by the Food and Drug Administration
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to add crystalline polymorph psilocybin in the permitted list of distributed and prescribed drugs, if scheduled or descheduled by the Food and Drug Administration.

bills.title: Removing certain drugs from schedule one
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove certain substances from schedule I of the Uniform Controlled Substances Act, including marihuana, Psilocybin, and Tetrahydrocannabinols.

bills.title: Relating to the controlled substance schedules and to clean-up errors identified in the code sections

bills.title: Amending penalty of simple possession of marijuana from misdemeanor crime to civil violation
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the penalty of simple possession of marijuana (less than 15 grams) from a misdemeanor crime to a civil violation.

bills.title: Relating to extended supervision for certain drug offenders
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to require extended supervision for certain drug offenders.

bills.title: Relating generally to medical cannabis
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve patient safety in the medical cannabis program by authorizing permitted, regulated medical cannabis processors to manufacture medical cannabis in edible form for dispensing to certified patients in the state; to specify certain requirements applicable to medical cannabis dispensed in edible form; and to require information relating to the dispensing of medical cannabis be input into the controlled substance monitoring database.

bills.title: Relating generally to medical cannabis
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve patient safety in the medical cannabis program by authorizing permitted, regulated medical cannabis processors to manufacture medical cannabis in edible form for dispensing to certified patients in the state; to specify certain requirements applicable to medical cannabis dispensed in edible form; and to require information relating to the dispensing of medical cannabis be input into the controlled substance monitoring database.

bills.title: Relating to the cultivation of medical cannabis
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit qualifying patients to grow and cultivate up to 10 cannabis plants for their own use with no more than five reaching maturity simultaneously.

bills.title: Relating to certification of a patient’s eligibility for medical cannabis
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant authority to attending physicians to use his or her professional judgement to certify that a patient's serious medical condition would benefit from the use of medical cannabis.

bills.title: Cannabis Legalization Amendment
bills.description: The purpose of this resolution is to allow citizens to possess for personal consumption up to two ounces, or up to four plants of cannabis; to allow the Legislature to regulate the manufacture and sale of cannabis; and to provide dismissal and expungement of prior convictions for possession of cannabis

bills.title: Amending Constitution to allow for possession, manufacture and sale of cannabis
bills.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would legalize cannabis possession; allow for the manufacture and sale of cannabis to be authorized by the Legislature; and allow the expungement and dismissal of convictions thereto.

bills.title: Lauren's Law
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to enhance the penalties for drug offenses and to match the federal drug offenses penalties.

bills.title: Relating to the offense of adulteration or alteration of medical cannabis testing results
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the offense of adulteration or alteration of medical cannabis testing results; defining offense; and setting forth penalties

bills.title: To require doctors that grant medical cannabis cards have a physical location withing the state of WV
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that doctors who grant medical cannabis cards have a physical office located within the state of West Virginia.

bills.title: Increasing penalties for drug possession and updating list of offenses
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase and modify sentences for certain controlled substances offenses; make certain offenses ineligible for suspension, probation, or alternative sentencing; make possession of Schedule I and II narcotics and methamphetamine a felony; authorize reduction from felony to misdemeanor under certain circumstances; declare a minimum period of 10 years' incarceration for the offense of drug delivery death; require inert substances mixed with controlled substances to be

bills.title: Relating to authorizing the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to dispensaries of the Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to dispensaries of the Medical Cannabis Program.

bills.title: Relating to authorizing the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Safe Harbor Letter for the Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Safe Harbor Letter for the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Relating to authorizing the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to laboratories of the Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to laboratories of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Relating to authorizing the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the general provisions of the Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the general provisions of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Relating to authorizing the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to growers and processors of the Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to grower and processors of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Department of Health rule relating to dispensaries of Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to dispensaries of the Medical Cannabis Program.

bills.title: Department of Health rule relating to laboratories of Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to laboratories of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Department of Health rule relating to Safe Harbor Letter for Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the Safe Harbor Letter for the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Department of Health rule relating to growers and processors of Medical Cannabis Program
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to grower and processors of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Clarification of penalties for offenses involving Fentanyl
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify certain requirements for the enhanced sentencing of crimes involving fentanyl and create criminal penalties.

bills.title: Creating Vape and Smoke Shop Location and Operating Requirements Act
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to regulate locations, operating requirements, and property standards for smoke shops and vape shops, establishing safe advertising that does not appeal to minors, setting standards for inspections, fines for violations, and appeals.

bills.title: Authorizing Department of Health to promulgate legislative rules
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Department of Health to promulgate a legislative rule relating to the general provisions of the Medical Cannabis Program.This section is new; therefore,

bills.title: Banning certain products from food in West Virginia
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to ban from foods sold in this state the dyes Red 3, Red 40, Yellow 5, Yellow 6, Blue 1, Blue 2 and Green 3.

bills.title: NIL Protection Act
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide rights, responsibilities, authorities and limitations relating to the name, image, and likeness of an individual who participating as a student-athlete in an institution of higher education. This article is new, therefore,

bills.title: To require drug testing of foster parents prior to child placement.
bills.description: The purpose of this bill relates to establishing a drug testing program for adults who apply to serve as foster parents, kinship parents, or caregivers to displaced children in the legal custody of the Department of Human Services.

bills.title: To require parole boards to take into account the sentencing judge’s recommendation at the time of sentencing
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to require a board of probation and parole to consider the sentencing judge's recommendation for certain qualifying offenses.

bills.title: To impose a life sentence on fentanyl dealers
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to impose a life sentence on fentanyl dealers.

bills.title: Sentencing guidelines for fentanyl
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to revise the sentencing guidelines for conviction of distribution of fentanyl.

bills.title: To create automatic restoration of Second Amendment rights upon completion of sentence for non-violent crimes
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant an automatic restoration of Second Amendment rights upon completion of a sentence and any other court-ordered penalties, restitution, or fines for those convicted of nonviolent felonies.

bills.title: Certain persons prohibited from possessing firearms
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to require any persons convicted in this state of any of the crimes referenced in subsections (a)(1) or (8) of Â§61-7-7 of this code to, sign a form at the time of conviction acknowledging they are now prohibited from possessing firearms, and will transfer any firearms to an individual or individuals not prohibited from possessing firearms.

bills.title: Permitting certain nonviolent offenders to be able to carry firearms.
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that the right to bear arms is a constitutional right and to provide when persons convicted of non-violent crimes may have their rights to bear arms reinstated. The bill also clarifies what constitutes a crime of violence and provides protection for residents in the exercise of their constitutional rights.

bills.title: Clarifying requirements for Commissioner of Bureau for Public Health
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the duties and responsibilities of the Secretary of the Department of Health, the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health, and the state health officer.

bills.title: Promoting personal agriculture
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to promote personal agriculture by making unenforceable a housing association covenant or restriction that prohibits home gardens and ownership of chickens. The bill defines terms and provides exceptions.

bills.title: Creating WV Constitutional Carry Act of 2025
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow those persons 18-20 years of age to be permitted to carry a deadly weapon as those persons 21 and over are currently permitted to do.

bills.title: To allow those who are 18-20 years old to carry a deadly weapon concealed without a permit, as is allowed for those who are 21 or older
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow those persons 18-20 years of age to be permitted to carry a deadly weapon, as those persons 21 and over are currently permitted to do.

bills.title: Relating to Constitutional Carry
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow those persons 18-20 years of age to be permitted to carry a deadly weapon, as those persons 21 and over are currently permitted to do.

bills.title: Creating new penalty and procedure for simple possession of certain Schedule I or II substances
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a new penalty and procedure for simple possession of a controlled substance classified in Schedule I or II which is a narcotic drug or which is methamphetamine.

bills.title: Requesting Joint Committee on Government and Finance study smoke shops
bills.description: Requesting Joint Committee on Government and Finance study smoke shops

bills.title: Authorizing higher education institutions to enter into agreements relating to student-athlete's name, image, or likeness
bills.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide rights, responsibilities, authorities and limitations relating to the name, image, and likeness of an individual who is participating as a student-athlete in an institution of higher education. This article is new, therefore,

bills.title: Civil penalties for cannabis.
bills.description: AN ACT relating to food and drugs; creating a civil penalty for offenses related to specified amounts of marijuana and amending related criminal penalties as specified; eliminating use of marijuana and possession of marijuana paraphernalia as crimes; amending the prohibition on practitioners prescribing marijuana; amending definitions; making conforming amendments; repealing a provision; requiring rulemaking; and providing for effective dates.

bills.title: Hospital employees-drug and alcohol testing.
bills.description: AN ACT relating to public health and safety; requiring a drug and alcohol testing program for all hospital employees and potential employees holding or seeking positions requiring safety sensitive duties; providing drug and alcohol counseling as specified; clarifying that the use of marijuana by hospital employees remains unlawful; amending and providing definitions; requiring rulemaking; and providing for effective dates.

bills.title: Regulation of hemp.
bills.description: AN ACT relating to hemp products; providing for regulation of the manufacture, distribution and sale of consumable hemp products as specified; requiring licensure of consumable hemp product manufacturers, distributors and retailers by the Wyoming liquor division; imposing an excise tax on the retail sale of consumable hemp products; providing definitions; providing penalties; requiring reports; requiring rulemaking; making conforming amendments; repealing conflicting provisions; and providing fo
